author: Vikas Vasudeva
text:
All-India Jat Arakshan Sangharsh Samiti Yash Pal Malik has blamed Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar for the situation in the State.

“It’s the Chief Minister’s inexperience that has led to this crisis ... We are planning to meet Union Home minister Rajnath Singh to request the Centre’s intervention,” he said on Saturday, vowing to intensify the agitation for demanding reservation for the Jats.

The State government, he said, was trying to break up the Jat agitation by spreading the message that it was “leaderless”.

At a media interaction in the morning, DGP Y.P. Singhal called the agitation “leaderless” and said the involvement of “some agitators” from outside the State could not be ruled out. He said 129 cases had been registered against the agitators. Mr. Khattar appealed again to the agitators to end their protest, saying the government had accepted their demands. “No one will benefit from damage to public property. Hence, those agitating should maintain peace and do not get swayed by rumours,” he said.
title: Khattar’s inexperience led to the crisis: Malik
